_exec_summary.SummaryText:
MEADOWLAND FARMERS COOP
HWY 30
WESTBROOK, MN 56183

THIS FACILITY IS NOW UNDER CONSTUCTION WITH PLANS FOR TWO 26,000 GALLON STORAGE
TANKS LOCATED ON THIS SITE. PLANS ARE TO HAVE THIS COMPLTED FOR FALL USE. AT THIS TIME WE HAVE MOVED OUR STORAGE TANK FROM STORDEN TO THIS LOCATION. WE HAVE PURCHASED ANOTHER TANK AND PLAN ON MOVING THIS IN THE NEAR FUTURE. THERE HAS NOT BEEN ANY 
PLUMBING DONE YET. WE HAVE NOT BEEN INSPECTED FROM AN OUTSIDE AGENCY AS OF NOW AND THAT IS WHY WE DO NOT HAVE DATES FOR THIS.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION; CONTACT CURT ERICKSON,AGONOMY MANAGER, AT 507-445-3451.

1. THE FACILITY POLICY

    THE OWNERS, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF MEADOWLAND FARMERS COOP ARE COMMITTED
TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL
RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT,
OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO
THE PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2. FACILITY INFORMATION:

    THE PRIMARY AT THE FACILITY WILL BE THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE
TO FARMERS.
     ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION.
     ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS USED FOR CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENTS.
     THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF AMMONIA STORED WOULD BE 403,000 POUNDS IN OUR TWO 26000
GALLON STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE THE 
UNLOADING OF A TANK TRUCK HOLDING 40000 POUNDS.

3. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO

    A. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCEARIO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF
THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF A STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OVER TEN MINUTES,. THE MAXIMUM
QUANTITY RELEASE WOULD BE 112,000 POUNDS WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE STOAGE
TANK AT 95 PERCENT CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS. THE DISTANCE TO  THE ENDPOINT
IS 2.51 MILES.

    B. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA BASED ON THE HAZARD
REVIEW IS A

2 MINUTE RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A 3 INCH PIPE. THE DISTANCE TO THE END POINT
(POINT OF DISPERSION TO 200 PPM) IS 1.56 MILES.

4. THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:

    THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE
AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA,K-61", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND
HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS 
AMMONIA. IN ADDITION, MN DEPARTMENT OF AG RULES.

5. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

    A. AS THIS IS A NEW FACILITY, WE HAVE NO PAST HISTORY. THIS FACILITY IS REPLACING OUR FACILITY IN STORDEN, MN AND THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THERE THAT:
          HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY;
NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, 
SHELTERINGIN PLACE,PROPERTY DAMAGE OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

    THE FACILITY HAS:

    A. A WRITTEN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29 CFR 
1910.36.

    B. PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY
RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA).

     C. COORDINATED WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

7. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

    SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT MEADOWLAND FARMERS COOP, PERIODIC
EVALUATIONS WILL BE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF CONDITIONS. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
